content.description:
Ton-a-mato is a fun route that provides a good challenge between the difficulty of the other two in the area. It's located on the East side of the rock.

Start by using the finger-sized pocket about head height on the left and foot placement about knee height. After the first move to get on the rock, there's a hand hold on a flake above your head on the right that will allow for you to step across with the left foot. At this point, you're directly below a few foot placements that will lead to the top, as there's not very many great hand holds higher up.
content.location:
It is located just to the right of "

Darth Mater

."

content.description:
If you're tall, start high and grab a jug. If you're short, it's possible to do a lower start on the ledge and work through some small holds to then gain the jugs, but it is harder than V0.

This is the easiest way to gain the top of the boulder.
content.location: It is on the North side of Tomato Rock.

content.description: On the south side of the boulder is a low ledge.  Sit down and pull through finger pockets to good holds at top making the most of this short face.  It is a pretty cool problem.
content.protection: A pad or spotter is not necessary but nice to jump to from the top.
